body_html:
hi Alex.

This is not simple as modifying accumulate_grad.cpp. A lot of our functions (in-fact 99% of our neural network layers) directly compute accumuated gradients for a full mini-batch. So, for a mini-batch, we never actually get separate gradients per sample.
To introduce the feature you propose, we probably have to change ~5k+ lines of code across the ~100 odd neural-net primitives we provide, and request our vendor libraries such as CuDNN provide non-accumulated gradient functions.

This feature request came up before (cant find the issue#).
Considering the niche nature (and the 6 months to 1 year effort to pull this off), we wont provide it.
